lines.text: Increases with amount of force, distance from axis to point of force
Torque proportional to component of force perpendicular to seesaw

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we calculate the torque acting on an object?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_i965:Torque] causes or opposes rotation. It is measured in newton meters.
2. When the [OBJ:expsec_i967:force is not perpendicular to the torque], torque is calculated by multiplying the position vector by the force, by the sine of the angle between the position vector and the force.
3. [OBJ:expsec_i968:Net torque] is the sum of all torques acting on an object.
